title: The non-convex planar Least Gradient Problem
authors: Samer Dweik, Piotr Rybka, Ahmad Sabra
abstract:
We study the least gradient problem in bounded regions with Lipschitz
boundary in the plane. We provide a set of conditions for the existence of
solutions in non-convex simply connected regions. We assume the boundary data
is continuous and in the space of functions of bounded variation, and we are
interested in solutions that satisfy the boundary conditions in the trace
sense. Our method relies on the equivalence of the least gradient problem and
the Beckman problem which allows us to use the tools of the optimal
transportation theory.
